title: Sgt . Yuval Ben Yakov legacy : Addressing antisemitism and unity
message:
On October 7, 2023, the first day of the war triggered by Hamas’s barbaric attack on Israel, my son, Sgt.
Yuval Ben Yakov (z”l), fell heroically defending our country.
For decades, I have professionally supported the development of vital connections between Israel and Jewish communities.
The dangers of social mediaSocial media, widely and almost unrestrictedly spreading xenophobic and antisemitic content, only accelerates this process.
In recent years, notable incidents rooted in antisemitism have been documented in the US, EU, and many other regions.

title: The Jews in Vienna : A Troubled History , and a Warning for Today ( PART TWO )
message:
In 1852, the Jewish community was permitted to establish a legally recognized community, albeit with a temporary status.
Following World War I, by 1923, the percentage of Jews in Vienna reached its peak at 10.8 percent of the population, making Vienna the third-largest Jewish community in Europe.
Austrian Jews went wherever they could — to England, France, Czechoslovakia, America, Shanghai, Africa, Australia, and Argentina.
This was a smaller percentage than in other countries because the Austrian Jews were initially forced to emigrate.
Today, Vienna’s Jewish community is regarded as one of the most dynamic in the European Union, yet it is a shadow of its Golden Age greatness.

title: Columbia Dean Involved in  Antisemitic  Text Exchange Will Remain on Staff While Others Resign
message:
One of the four Columbia University deans involved in exchanging "deeply upsetting" texts with "antisemitic tropes" will remain on staff, while the other three have resigned.
Susan Chang-Kim, former vice dean and chief administrative officer of Columbia College; Matthew Patashnick, former associate dean for student and family support; and Cristen Kromm, former dean of undergraduate student life, left their positions on Wednesday.
Meanwhile, Columbia College Dean Josef Sorrett plans to stay on staff.
Sorrett also replied "LMAO" to one of Chang-Kim's other messages seemingly mocking Kraft Center for Jewish Student Life Executive Director Brian Cohen.
The messages were exchanged during a campus event titled "Jewish Life on Campus: Past, Present, and Future," where Jewish campus leaders voiced their concerns about antisemitism.

title: Biden DNC speech highlights the party struggle with Israel - Gaza
message:
For instance, the loss of five or ten percent of the Jewish vote in Pennsylvania could make the whole difference in this election.
'These protests have a point'“Those protesters out in the street, they have a point,” Biden said.
Biden’s wink to the anti-Israel protesters on the street was not the only problem with Biden’s brief comments on the war.
Biden’s speech was carefully written for him, reflecting the delicate balance the party is trying to maintain.
The Jewish base of the party needs to let it be known that it, too, has feelings and expectations.

title: Biden Says Anti - Israel Protesters  Have a Point  in Democratic National Convention Speech
message:
US President Joe Biden stressed the necessity of a ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas and suggested protesters against the Jewish state “have a point” during his speech at the 2024 Democratic National Convention (DNC) on Monday night.
Biden then referenced anti-Israel protesters who gathered outside the DNC to oppose US support for the Jewish state.
On Monday, anti-Israel protesters flooded the streets outside of the DNC in Chicago, condemning the Democratic Party for issuing support to Israel’s ongoing war efforts against Hamas.
The demonstrators bellowed chants such as “Biden, Biden you can’t hide — we charge you with genocide.” The demonstrators similarly targeted US Vice President Kamala Harris, who is expected to be formally named the Democratic presidential nominee later this week.
Biden’s suggestion that anti-Israel protesters “have a point” was met with widespread criticism online.

title: John Fetterman Has No Regrets Once a party darling , the senator pro - Israel stance has led to protests outside his home and detractors inside his office . Now , he tells Peter Savodnik , he skipping the DNC … By Peter Savodnik
message:
John Fetterman Has No Regrets Once a party darling, the senator’s pro-Israel stance has led to protests outside his home and detractors inside his office.
There is perhaps no one in the party right now more unlike John Fetterman than Kamala Harris.
Once upon a time, in 2022, John Fetterman was a symbol of Rust Belt cool.
The people, like John Fetterman, who are old enough to be sane, but not too old to speak to younger voters.
Read his piece “I Was Wrong About John Fetterman” and Follow him on X (formerly Twitter) @petersavodnik.

Late last week, that movement, spearheaded by the Pittsburgh Democratic Socialists of America, came to a head.
A new Emerson College Polling-Real Clear Pennsylvania survey found 49% of voters support Trump and 48% support Harris for president in the Keystone State.

title: Demonstrators chant , break fencing , but first major protest of DNC stays mostly peaceful
message:
As protest leaders kept marching later in the afternoon, several protesters broke down the first barrier of the security perimeter along Washington Boulevard just north of the United Center.
By 4 p.m., the crowd had reached Park 578, a smaller park within view of the United Center two blocks to the south.
Rally programming in Union Park kicked off around 12:30 p.m. before a crowd of about 2,000 people, including scores of credentialed journalists.
With the most powerful Democrats gathering at the United Center, Chicago has become a focus point.
Far from the spontaneous gatherings of 2020, the largest expected demonstrations around the United Center have been pre-planned, scheduled and permitted to the hilt.

title: Ottawa Pride stance on Israel has Liberals , U . S ., some civil servants exit parade
message:
This week is the Pride week for both the federal capital as well as the civil service.
"The Treasury Board Secretariat did not provide any central guidance or direction on participation in this year's Capital Pride events," wrote spokesman Martin Potvin.
Two major local hospitals have pulled out, arguing Capital Pride wasn't being adequately inclusive.
The embassy listed a series of Pride events it will take part in that aren't run by Capital Pride.
Pride events have to be a safe and supportive space for all 2SLGBTQIA+ people," the embassy wrote on X.

title: Biden tells the DNC :  I love my job , but I love my country more
message:
Drew Angerer/Getty Images / Getty Images North America Anita Dunn, former senior adviser to President Biden, pictured as she departs the White House on Jan. 23.
Ahead of the start of the DNC, All Things Considered host Ailsa Chang spoke with Anita Dunn, a former advisor to President Joe Biden, in Chicago.
Dunn said Kamala Harris “needs to make it clear what the difference is” between her economic platform and Trump's.
It's why [Biden] picked her in 2020 to be vice president, and it's why he supported her in 2024.
She needed to pick a vice president.
